Reviews.Title: “Rouge et Noir Groupon”
Reviews.Author: Tony T
Reviews.Content: We refered to Trip Advisor to look up this Hotel before we left and there were mixed reviews. We were there for 3 nights on a Groupon break and found that yes it was a way out of Rome itself, but it wasn't that bad around 20 minutes to get in by minibus. Most places in Rome are a nightmare to get to, it's the nature of the beast. The hotel was clean and tidy and everything worked which is important to most of us. The staff at first seemed frosty but I again think that generally Italians are, so I wasn't put off by this. The food was more than acceptable, we had breakfast every day and although the scrambled eggs and bacon were not what we would get in England, we weren't in England and there was plenty of other things that more than made up for it and at 4.5 Euros very reasonable. We also has a 3 course dinner in the evening and this was excellent and very generous portions. The only down side, if there has to be one is that you could not control the room temperature and the weather was not great and on one night we would have welcomed a little heat in the room. If you go this time of year I would suggest warmer clothing until the temperature rises a bit. We had a great time in Rome and look forward to returning one day, but probably in the city centre, as , for £85.00 on a Groupon was fantastic value, if I were going again i would want to be closer to the centre because the shuttle bus has restricted time and once you were back at the hotel that was pretty much you for the night unless you pay 18 euros each way for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: Treuiller
Reviews.Content: The staff cannot be any nicer and friendlier, but the hotel is too far from the most relevant places at the Città eterna: one needs to take their shuttle (6€ return, with three set times during the day to go and get back), hire a taxi, use the public transport or just take a very long walk. Breakfast is poor, and even poorer for groups (dinner is slightly better). Rooms are OK, but beds are too narrow, unless they were expecting Lilliputian hosts when they bought them. Finally, the fees for the use of Wi-Fi are just theft.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daisy L
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!! Firstly the hotel is MILES away from the centre and the bus comes and goes as it pleases with seemingly no timetable. The reception - make sure you take confirmation of what you are to pay as the reception threatened to call the police as we refused to pay the £50 extra they had added on which they claimed was detailed in the email we recieved (we proved them wrong!) One man on reception was particularly rude and unhelpful with little English. The rooms - there is nothing 4star about them!! Shabby, dirty, no plug sockets, air con doesn't work (we were moved three times into different rooms and the air con didn't work in any of these rooms) extra bed sheets haven't been washed in years. The food - don't even bother . . . worst pizza I have ever eaten! After moving rooms twice due to unsuitable facilities i.e. twin room when requested a double we found on our third night that we were surrounded in all directions by a very large NOISY group of students. Needing to be up early for our flight we rang reception at 11 to complain about the noise to be told there was teachers with the group and they would quiten down soon. At half 12 we requested to move rooms, this didn not go down well however reluctantly reception moved us to yet another twin room. Considering the hotel is so big I didn't understand why they thought putting a large group of students amongst holidaying couples was a good idea. The only good thing about this hotel is the shuttle bus driver, lovely guy. To cut a long story short, DON'T GO!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, very far from city center.”
Reviews.Author: aronuz
Reviews.Content: Can't say much about the hotel. Staff wasn't too bad, but hotel shows signs of poor maintenance. Overall, good place to sleep if you don't mind a long trip to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Not Actually That Bad!”
Reviews.Author: daniella d
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Groupon, so based on the fact was a great deal, we thought was really good value for money! When you go to rome, MAJORITY of the time it is for the site seeing, so generally the hotel is just a place to sleep anyway, and the hotel was absolutely fine for this use. We were on the 8th floor, and can't really fault it if I'm honest, not 4* quality, as in it could do with a lick of paint and being modernised, but was very clean which is probably the main thing people hope for! The fact it is a good distance away from the centre, is a bit of an inconvinience, but the shuttle bus was always on time etc so if you planned your day around that it isn't much of a problem - plus there is always the metro/bus you could get if the times were an inconvinience. If I went to rome again I probably would choose a hotel which was in the centre, however as this was a groupon deal if I'm honest couldn't pick a fault with it! I'm writing this because all these reviews worried me about going, so if you have already booked with groupon/booked in general I wouldn't panic! P.S. the croissants are lovely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, quite poor”
Reviews.Author: smurfs2007
Reviews.Content: Big hotel but very poor.Went for a couples holiday to rome for 12 days, the hotel didn't stop us enjoying it but had we been in a better hotel it certainly would have enriched the trip further. STAFF: *Upon arriving our roomw asn't ready so we had to wait, the member of staff was rude and not at all helpful *Had to have our battery changed on the door lock thing (can't be helped they run out) but person who fixed it used our key card to change it then left with it and didn't come back to give it us so had to get a new one done *Charged 'new city tax' on check out, we booked with 'all taxes included' and this ta came in after we'd booked, to the best of my knowledge they had no right to charge us for the new tax as a result but did anyway HOTEL: *Looks old and in need of maintanance *There was a charge for the use of the pool *The hotel's a few miles from the city centre so there was a shuttle bus, but only a few a day and at quite infrequent, odd times *Went to the restaurant on the first night, was VERY expensive for the small amount you got. The staff seemed disinterested and quite annoyed at us even being there, the food a long time to arrive and because we barely had anything as the main meal we wanted to order desert but had to wait half an hour before the waitress came back to us, despite the fact she'd walked pas tthe room 10 times going back and ofrth between the kitchen and the buffey room. Did not eat there again,a dn just a 5 minute walk down the road are some much cheaper and better restaurants including a an excellent pizzeria (Pizzeria Laboratoio) with a friendly and involved owner who makes the effort to talk to and get to know customers, I really advise you to go there instead. Plus it's half the price of the restauant, nicer and you get more. ROOM: *Struggled with electrics at first because no-one explained you needed your key card in a slot to get it working *No-one had dusted under the bed for what looked like a very long time *Temperamental shower *Air-con was a god-send in July *Balcony but to get on it you ahve to lift heavy metal shutter by hand, not advised for the elderly etc *Not much effort was made generaly to clean the room, the staff clearly did the bare minimum *Bed was ok but the double bed was just 2 single matresses held together by the sheet so of course, they came apart EVERY night *Described as free internet online but there was a charge when we got there VALUE: *Was a cheap hotel but even given that I wouldn't say it was value for money. Overall very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4 star or close to the centre of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Booked through Groupon under the premise that this was a 4 star hotel in Rome and we were getting a good deal. Unfortunately it was not near the centre of Rome and the hotel was struggling to be 2 star let alone 4! It is a good 20 minute metro ride and then a 20 minute walk down back allies with stray cats, dog mess and interesting locals until you make it to the hotel. From the outside it looks awful but actually the ground floor isn't shocking and the rooms are pretty clean. As we were there to enjoy ourselves we treated it as a place to sleep and nothing more. They have a pool but it's outside and not covered at all in the winter so was full of leaves when we went! Overall we had a good trip but the hotel was definitely not a plus point.

Reviews.Title: “Run down, and way too far from anything!!”
Reviews.Author: bombshell9
Reviews.Content: Don't go to this hotel, Totally out of the way, have to get the hotel bus which doesn't go very often and finishes early or a taxi if you get one, we got the normal bus and ended up getting very lost!! eventually finding a taxi, Rooms are in bits mirrors cracked, bath leaking , shutter would only open up half way, bed was comfy though, room was old, smelly and dirty, tv was the rubbish, there coffee was fantastic but breakfast was basically cheese, ham, cereal and sweet breads, staff were rude bar one woman who basically ran the pool bar, (which is outside the hotel), restaurant and the other "bar" at one stage serving drinks in the "bar" which was basically non existent (as she was the only one who could make cocktails even though they had a cocktail menu) with an apron on and food all over it and at one stage when she was too busy they told us we could only buy beer cause they couldn't make drinks and they closed it at 10.00 (even though it said 11 in the booklet), and when we complained to the manager he just shrugged and said it was up to the barman, and went i pointed all these issues out to him, he basically told me that they shouldn't be 4 star, and apologised, but said they were out of his hands, they were obviously understaffed and it looked to me like the hotel was just being left to rot. its not worth saving a few bob if you take into account the taxi cost etc, its worth paying that little bit more to be close to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to be 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: vladislavp2008
Reviews.Content: Reception speak english very bad.I pay for 3 adults room we got 1 kid size bed.For 3 piple we got 1 chair.1 small soap.Air conditioner didnt work.I tell twise noubody fix it.Ours room been very nosy buses beeng runing nougth time.Woolpaper bing damaged,floor bing durty,only 1 cocket bing working well in bothroom.No kettle in the room.Very old TV.Durty place biside hotel .Very durty swiming pool terible.Small narrow and dengerous corner road beside hotel.I beeng lot of diferent hotels som of them 3 star mach beter theh 4 stars of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, would not stay here again though”
Reviews.Author: kylesgirl328
Reviews.Content: They should not have a 4 star title. The lobby was pretty but the rest of the hotel was really run down. Our rooms werent bad, the only problem was there are no screens on the windows and it was hot. So we couldnt open the windows because of the horrible mosquitos, it did have air conditioning though. But the weather was gorgeous out, bummer. The American breakfast was really yummy. Dinner not so much and pretty pricey. We used the hotel bus to get downtown and a taxi back. The bus runs 3 Euro and the taxi (from the train station) was 12. Not too bad at all. There is nothing close to the area at all. But if you are looking for a cheap place to stay this is it. Just be prepared to use a lot of public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, but it's best days are gone.”
Reviews.Author: zadunajska8
Reviews.Content: The first thing to say about the Hotel Rouge et Noir is that it is excellent value for money in a city where hotel rooms are extremely expensive. The hotel has an official 4 start rating (and so attracts the 4&5 star rate of local tourist tax at EUR3 per person per night) and it is possible to see that it probably did once deserve such a rating. The only problem is that the hotel has seen it's best days some years ago. The rooms do look a bit worn now with some scuffs to the walls and other general cosmetic maintainence not being attended to as you would expect a 4 star hotel to do so. We did however have a comfortable bed, working air conditioning and a fridge in our room. The room was cleaned daily and adequately with fresh towels and bed linen. Interestingly we did not have a bin in the room and the only electric plug socket was behind the TV unit and so we had to pull out the furniture and unplug the TV to use it. We did not have breakfast included in the package we booked and so had to pay EUR6 per person per day that we wanted to have breakfast at the hotel. On the first day we skipped breakfast at the hotel because the restaurant was swarming with a number of large Italian coach parties and we could not get a table and the noise level was dreadful. On the other 4 days this was not a problem and the food (both in terms of quality and variety) was very good. One slip up was that on our last day the restaurant opened at 7am but they didn't start to bring out food for anyone except a coach party staying there until 7.15 and we had to leave by 7.30 to make our flight, which made it even more rushed. We did try the hotel A la carte restaurant for an evening meal. It was very expensive for what you get. The portions are tiny and leave you very hungry and it is not great quality (but perfectly edible). The prices of wine in the restaurant can be alarming but the local red wine (or Rosso Lazio) is perfectly good and drinkable and a lot cheaper than any of the other choices. Don't order the "fresh fruit" from the dessert menu as you will be disappointed! This is not a fruit salad or similiar. You actually just get a bowel containing 1 apple, 1 orange and 1 peach - nothing done to them at all. Nice enough if that's what you want but not for such a price! The Hotel does provide a shuttle bus service to the city centre (near Termini metro station) which we used a couple of times but as it only runs in each direction 5 times daily it just never suited when we wanted to go back. We instead used the local metro and buses which are quick (sometimes there is a bit of a wait at Pietralata for bus 211) but if you are tired it might seem like a bit of a trek. The hotel says get off at the 7th stop from Pietralata but we found that it was better to get off at the 8th stop as there is a pavement all the way to the start of the hotel driveway (very steep) from this stop. From the 7th stop you have to walk at the edge of the road for part of the way which we did not like. The area is a bit run down and certainly not the best of areas but also it's not that bad. It's better than many areas of London and we didn't feel in any way threatened or intimidated - it's just not a rich area and has some rather sorry looking ex industrial sites nearby. The staff in the Hotel had very variable standards of English but the reception staff had a good knowledge of a number of languages and everyone did seem to want to help as much as they could even if there was sometimes a bit of a communication barrier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Daolinite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent five nights at the Rouge Et Noir. We had a lovely experience. The room was clean, we had hot showers and air conditioning. The beds were comfy and the staff was nice. Follow DottoPilot's review on how to get to the hotel. The hotel is outside of the city a bit, but it is easy to get to via bus and metro. If you will be staying at Rouge Et Noir, be sure to eat around the hotel and not inside Rome. The best meals we had were at two restaurants at the hotel! To get to the two restaurants, go down the hill from the hotel, the pizzaria is a short walk on the right and the other restaurant is a short walk on the left. They were excellent, true local places!

Reviews.Title: “Totally awfull”
Reviews.Author: Thomasduden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very far away from the city, so you need to take both metro and bus to get there. Fortunately, you can take the shuttle bus that leaves 5 times a day for €3. The worst part is the room. First we got a romm in the first floor. When we went out on the balcony, there were squized fruits on the floor. The shower curtains on the toilet there were mould all over. The shower head could not be attached to the wall, so you had to hold it. The room was dark and the wallpaper was teard off. We got a new room after complaining but this room had almost all of the same problems plus the carpet was really really dirty. Some of the staff were also very roud.

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for our trip...”
Reviews.Author: xxglitterfairyxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our trip although might not be suitable for everyone. We rode to the hotel on the motorbike and parked it there. The hotel is quite far out of the center of rome but we used the hotel bus shuttle which was 3 euros per person for a return. The shuttle was fine and the driver was quite funny but the times were a bit awkward. But it worked fine for us although we often ended up running to catch it because of our own bad time keeping. But if you miss it, there's quite a wait for another. You can probably get about by other means though if you asked at reception. The room was slightly less nice than I expected since it was supposed to be four star, but it did perfectly for us and we did get it at a good price so I can't complain. It also had a balcony which was great for catching some sun and the view was pretty. Had a pool but we didn't use it as you had to pay extra and we were mostly in the historic centre anyway. The restaurant was not great, if you like two apples and a banana for your dessert which are unpeeled with the stickers still on, go their and order the fruit. The waitress didn't even write our orders down so it was no suprise when she got it wrong. The breakfast on the other hand which was included, was perfectly fine. Just try eating it in the smaller room on the right hand side as opposed to the larger one, it's better. Reception staff and breakfast staff were lovely, and reception even printed us a map to our other destination when our sat nav died!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden extras will make this more expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: martinpterry
Reviews.Content: + clean and basic rooms (not 4*) + good shuttle bus service (costs €3) + nice pizzaria's nearby (not a great area tho!) - cost €3 to use the swimming pool per day! - they add €3 per person per night tax at the end of your stay! - I know why they are on the Secret Hotel, cause you would find better if you compared it to somewhere else before booking !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Way outside the city!”
Reviews.Author: Emsworth05
Reviews.Content: As previous reviews have pointed out, this is miles outside the city, so you can forget about doing any spontaneous exploration or staying out late. While there is a shuttle service, I ended up missing it once and having to take a costly cab back. The rooms are getting on, and have a slightly run down feel to them. On the plus side, you do get a bathtub. The view is just urban wasteland. Service was adequate, as was breakfast. I didn't enjoy having to pay for wifi in the room, and for print outs in the lobby. There also is a decent pizzeria nearby. I would not stay here again. Rome is nowhere near as compact as Firenze, and you really do need in or around the city center to make the most of your visit.

Reviews.Title: “a very comfortable stay, will come back again.”
Reviews.Author: shabz67
Reviews.Content: Our trip to rome was a very memorable one, our hotel was comfortable and in a quite area just outside the city. Our room was clean and bright with a balcony. The hotel staff were very helpful and always smiling:). We loved rome and the people of rome. Defintely going back there soooon:)

Reviews.Title: “Do not come here without your own transport or are happy with lots of walking”
Reviews.Author: hapaco
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rouge et Noir is a long way out on the edge of city of Rome. To reach it from Terminii, it is necessary to travel by Metro to Pietralata or to Tiburtina stations and then catch the 211 bus to near the Hotel, a 500 metre walk up a steep hill, and you are there! Time taken about 40 to 50 mins. The Hotel, while clean and tidy, is very much a 2.5 star because of the basic breakfast, which could so easily be much better. Poor quality juice, bread which is not fresh most of the time, no fresh fruit, really basic basic. Biggest drawback is location on the northeast rim, too far out for tourist visitors

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Nelie
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Rome having spent 3 nights in this hotel which I booked through Last Minute.com, Top Secret Hotels, at a total cost of £120. When I read the reviews I too panicked, but I need not have worried as I found this hotel very pleasant. Yes, it was a little far out of the city, but the shuttle bus was fantastic (3 euros return), as the departure and return times were very varied throughout the day and for a three night stay this was fine. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was cleaned every day and towels changed, Breakfast was the usual continental. Bread ( not stale!) croissants, cereal, cheese and ham, yogurts, juices. No fresh fruit though. We travelled into the city on public transport as well, which was very easy. 211 bus to the nearest metro station which was Pietralada. This cost 4 euros and the ticket covers all day travel for both buses and metro.If you dont mind the inconvenience of staying a bit out of the city then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gwyndaff1974
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel for our anniversary via LastMinute.com 'Mystery Hotel' and we styed for 3 nights at a total cost of £120. My wife panicced a bit when she read various reviews claiming that this was a bad hotel. Our experience was quite the contrary. From beginning to end our stay at this hotel was great. As the hotel is about 10-15minutes outside the centre of Rome, we emailed asking for directions. They replied very quickly with very concise instructions on trains and busses, which we followed to the letter and got directly to their door, or their steep driveway anyway. The room was very clean and was cleaned daily. The staff were friendly and courteous. We didn't eat at the hotel so I couldn't comment on the food but the bar was great if a little expensive but then it is a hotel bar so we expected to pay a little over the odds. They ran a shuttle service to and from Termini, Rome's central bus/metro station which was only 3 euros for a return, this ran at various times throughout the day for pickups and drop offs. Just around the corner from the hotel was a small pizzeria which was lovely and very cheap. About 5 euros for a pizza. They were very nice too. All in all, I have nothing to complain about. The hotel was great. We were only there for 3 nights so we could sightsee in Rome but we were made to feel very welcome that whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad.... in fact rather good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Octopus1401
Reviews.Content: Ok, there is NO service, but what do you expect for that price in Rome??? Rooms are decent and clean, bathroom are fine, enough storage. There is a restaurant and a bar with decent opening times and edible-enough food (I would not go as far as to say "good"..). Location is the real pain. But there is a large car park! This is an Easyjet equivalent on the hotel front: does the job for an affordable price, no frills....

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: paulistaSorocaba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far from 4 stars, the location is horrible, not center at all, they have a shuttle service to center (3 euros per person). But the staff is friendly, the reception works and its clean. The rooms are not new, need a refurbishment, but it's quiet and confortable. The breakfast it's free and very nice. The restaurants near the hotel (you have to walk in a dangerous and busy avenue) are great, to local people, one of them needs reservation ! Resuming, the hotel is in a middle of nowhere, but only to sleep, it's very nice and confortable. Nao eh dos piores que ja ficamos, mas da pra quebrar um bom galho. Eh longe do centro, tem um onibus que leva e traz mas os horarios sao pessimos, entao com criancas, decidimos pegar taxi alguns dias, sai mais ou menos 15 euros. Não é horrível, tampouco excelente.

Reviews.Title: “outrageous”
Reviews.Author: gazgray142
Reviews.Content: staff rude miles away from anywhere in rough area rooms dirty bite to death would rather of stayed in airport

Reviews.Title: “-Dirty carpets in room. Regardless of...”
Reviews.Author: Hotelspyguy
Reviews.Content: -Dirty carpets in room. Regardless of price a hotel should be clean, this hotel was disgustingly filthy! -Poor service. -Miles out of town. -Rip off Taxi's booked by hotel with meters running from when hotel orders taxi. -Tired pool -disposable plastic cups for breakfast (remember 4 star hotel) - If you fancy a dirty weekend this hotel will not let you down

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster! Nothing like the website suggested.”
Reviews.Author: JessTradders
Reviews.Content: After a week in Sorrento, my fiance and I traveled back into Rome for our flight back home the following day. We wanted somewhere with a pool so I could go shopping and my fiance could stay behind at the hotel and relax (we have already done the touristy thing in Rome). At face value the hotel seemed fine and for 50 euro it was a steal. But it came at a price! 1. The hotel was quite out of the way from the city centre and all cabs either charged a flat rate, or if calling one from the hotel they start their meter from the moment you call - so you can potentially have a 12 euro fare before you even get into the car! 2. Getting to the metro required a decent walk and a bus, taking a considerable amount of time. 3. It is implied that the pool is part of the hotel - it is not. It is a separate business close by that costs 3 euros to use and is a miserable excuse for a pool area with lots of noisy teenagers. 4. Now the shower. Oh boy. Firstly it wasn't cleaned properly with the previous guests 'hair' remaining on the soap dish. The shower head was broken. We went down to reception (as they weren't answering the phone) and finally someone came up to take a look at it but were unable to fix it and couldn't offer us another room. So we had to shower while holding the shower head ourselves - not impressed. 5. The breakfast was nothing to write home about. In actual fact I'd suggest choosing to sleep in than to bother waking up for it. Overall, I think the money you'll be spending on cabs etc you're better off looking for something closer to the city centre. Although it was a bargain, we weren't impressed with the service, lack of wifi, and the state of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: allthewaylive
Reviews.Content: think of everything you wouldnt want in a hotel, bundle them together and that is what you get with this hotel. i wont waste any more of my time writing this rewiew, and your time reading it. avoid. simople as.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience!”
Reviews.Author: Clean-Sleuth
Reviews.Content: I have just discovered lastminute TOP SECRET hotels and booked Rouge Et Noir through the website. I was really worried when I read all the reviews. I would recommend (if you are visiting this fine establishment) that you read dottopilot's review to get directions. We found the hotel without any problems. We had a triple room with a balcony. It is not 4 stars as we know 4 stars but it was clean and everything worked. The breakfast of croissants was adequate. The shuttle service that they run to and from the centre of Rome was a definite winner and made our experience very pleasurable! The staff were very friendly. We did not want to eat dinner in the hotel (quite pricey) and so asked for any recommendations. We were sent to the Pizzeria (down the driveway and turn right). It was FABULOUS. The food was delicious (ask for the lamb on the spit... yum!), the price was reasonable and it is definitely a local spot (which we enjoyed!). We arrived the first night at about 7:45pm and were a bit concerned that there were only two other tables occupied. By the time we left, there was a queue all the way out into the street! It became our local hang-out whilst in Rome! :-) All in all, I would go back to this hotel. I enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a friendly hotel, only good thing is the pool.”
Reviews.Author: zet21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definatly not 4star, the hot water ran out on us every morning. The breakfast was horrible (well if you like sweet anything for breakfast then you would like it cause that is all there is). The staff are so rude, the lady on reception doesn't seem to care, the guy behind the bar tried to rip us off. The only nice lady is the one that works in the pool area and sometimes behind the bar, she always had a smile and really made our holiday. It is miles out of town so if you decide to catch the shuttle bus get on early because if you don't, you miss out and it only goes in twice in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isit4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what I would say OK, but not a 4 star one. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. It had air condition but we sat it on 16 degrees (it was 37 outside) but it never got really cold. All the public areas where worn down and screamed late eighties or early nineties. Wireless internet was 10 euro per hour! And the pool cost 3 euro, why we asked our selves, a 4 star hotel should have internet and pool included. The breakfast was a joke, dry bred, yoghurt that had been sitting out, juice that tasted like water and cheese and ham that lay out in the heat. That and some sweet buns and coffee was it. Nothing was fresh. The staff in the reception where not so helpful, we had to travel to the airport at 04.00 in the morning; they told us our only option was a taxi for 75 euro (!). We went down to the Terimini station and asked the tourist information ourselves, and there was a bus at 03.45 for only 7 euro. The location of the hotel was not so good; it was in an industry area so nothing was around. A plus to the hotel was that they had a shuttle bus to down town several times a day for 3 euro per round trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Hard to find first time via train, subway & Bus.”
Reviews.Author: dottopilot
Reviews.Content: Followed directions included with reservations to find hotel. After flying from DCA-JFK- FCO we were tired. Directions were not specific enough to find the correct bus after leaving Pietralata subway station. One needs to depart subway station to the right after coming up stairs. Then once outside cross street and take 211 Bus headed right to left, east bound. Take bus to about the 5th stop. You will see big cement hotel on top of hill on your left. Bus stop is just beyond hotel. The hotel has a great service of providing tour bus to take you to city center from hotel and bring you home. It costs 3 EURO round trip per person. It leaves hotel at 7:45, 9:45, 15:00, 19:00 and 22:00. It picks up @ Antico Cafe del Teatro Marcello ( Great place to eat) @ 8:45, 12, 16:30, 20:30, 23:15. It is great way to go for 1 euro more then the subway bus. We ordered a quad room with a cot for family of five. We found out that a cot in Europe is a baby bed. So we had to pay 50 Euro more for another room. Ended up working out good having 2 showers with five people. Bath tub is big. Great for Roman bath. Shower has great water pressure. Front desk was very helpfull with directions, especially if you make attempt to speak italiain. Bonjouno and Prego, etc. Ended up being a good place for family of five within 30- 40 minutes of downtown once we figured out the correct bus to take. Good A/C, Clean room, Beds narrow but comfortable after long day of touring. Breakfast was continental but good for the price. Take bus 211 to grocery store and get your own box of cereal and fruit and it makes it alot better. Overall once found it is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rouge et Noir is in Rome. 'Nuff Said.”
Reviews.Author: mrsbrowning
Reviews.Content: Like the reviewer below, I am traveling with students to Europe next month, so the company sent us to Rome to "go through the motions" of the trip. Having never been to Europe before, I had heard unappetizing things about the hotel rooms. I was pleasantly surprised with Hotel Rouge Et Noir. We were so busy every day, that really all we had time to do in our rooms was sleep and shower, and all of that was clean and available. We hung out in the lobby a couple of nights, and the staff was really nice and never told us crazy, loud Americans (and Canadians!) to quiet down and go to bed. They have a bar and coffee shop down there. We also used the meeting room, which was nice. The food - ugh, but whatever. The breakfast was the best I think. The view from the balcony was great. The location was the worst part, as everyone has made it clear. Yes, you'll have to take a taxi or bus into and back from town. And, the taxi driver probably won't even know where your hotel is (carry their business card-it will help - trust me). So, in conclusion, If you have a bus, yes. If you don't, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronerick
Reviews.Content: My husband, along with 3 other chaperones, are taking 48 students to Europe this coming spring. As part of the travel companies "perks", they offer a 3 night sight seeing/information session. Being the company specializes in group tours, I think they chose Rouge Et Noir as it would be the kind of property they would book for their clients/customers. I can say, from previous reviews on this place, I wasn't too optimistic about staying here. I can honestly say I was pleasantly surprised. The place had very nice staff, was quite clean, and the food was decent. It's not the ritz, but I don't think they pretend to be. The only draw back is the location. It is about a 20.00 euro taxi ride into the center of Rome. However, since we were on this small tour, they had a bus to take us to the sights. We met really nice people on this short conference and felt very safe at this hotel. So, if you're ever traveling with a group, that's not especially fussy about fancy digs, and have prebooked transportation, I wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here unless you have a car! even then - just don't”
Reviews.Author: mimibuni
Reviews.Content: We were tricked into staying at this hotel by LAst inute.com- the title of the "secret" hotel being - located near the centre of Rome. I am not a pcky traveller,- i know you get what you pay for - however - false advertising is jsut mean. the hotel was out in the sticks - take the tube almost to teh end of teh line - then get a bus which comes every 40 mins - not 20! - no street lamps along the road with no pavement to get to the bottom of the hill the hotel was on top of. Hotel room was a nice size but eth shower head holder was broekn, there was no mini bar - only vending machines at the end of the hall. shop like roller shutter on the window to the balcony - thin walls and beds that creaked - A LOT! we had paid for a double room - and were presented with a key to a room with two single beds held together with a fitted sheet. We were woken up at 5.30 each morning by a morning trumpet player somewhere out side the hotel. we had the windows closed but it still managed to get through. the breakfast wasw AWFUL - its italy surely the coffee should be nice? - NO instant from a machine- absooutely gross. - if you had a nut allergy - like i did - you could not eat any breakfast as even the bread had nuts in it. A horrible shame as rome is s o nice that this could be advertised as near teh center - 45 minutes on public transport is not "near the centre".

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in 4 Stars Quality Hotel Rouge Et Noir!”
Reviews.Author: artistalla
Reviews.Content: As an experienced traveler (I travel for my job at least once a month to major countries such as France, UK, China, Russia…) I want to say that it was the worst hotel experience in my life. First the location: it is located in run-down area Eight Kilometers from the City Centre! My advise for next visitors -do not take chances with public or hotel's busses, just ask front desk to call taxi for you. It takes forever to get to the City Center from this hotel! From the city Center you will have to take bus to the metro and then bus to the hotel, no Taxies want to drive to hotel Rouge Et Noir and even if they will cost you 100 Euros if you are very lucky. Second, the hotel itself is very poor, rooms are depressing. Our room had a stained sofa and old dirty carpet. I have actually cried when I saw our room and I am 48 years old... my daughter was shocked. Third, the food is not great, but what can you expect... Just look at the broken Hotel signs that are directly in front of the common entrance and run far-far away. It says a lot about the "Quality Hotel Rouge Et Noir Roma"!!!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: 2fromKent
Reviews.Content: * Located in run-down area * Not centrally located * Basic rooms * Very small shower cubicle. * Dirty carpets - wear socks! * Beds are very, very hard and uncomfortable. Tried to make ours softer with blankets from the cupboard but these were stained and smelt of must and sweat. * Dangerous balcony overlooking car-park. * Breakfast is awful - one choice of cereal (Museli), warm milk, no tea, just lots of donut type pastries. * Swimming pool does not actually belong to the hotel and you have to pay 3 euros per person to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located - are you kidding??”
Reviews.Author: Simiesan
Reviews.Content: After arriving there after midnight from Leonardo DaVinci airport with an 85 Euro cab fare (on the meter), our taxi driver thought we were crazy to stop there and kept asking us in broken English if it was cheap. The final stage of the journey was completed along graffiti splash alleyways lined with factories and car mechanics. I am sorry to say that more than one of our party thought that the taxi driver was taking us somewhere out of the way for nefarious reasons (sorry taxi driver for thinking that). The room was depressing with uncomfortable beds and a dangerous looking balcony with views over the car park. When we checked in the guy in reception took about ten minutes to explain how we could get into town the next day by either catching the hotel coach or by a complicated method involving getting a bus to a metro stop and then travel into the centre. Basically you needed to catch the hotel bus at 9:45am otherwise you would have to wait until 3:00pm before the next hotel bus into town, failing that of course you could take your chances on a metro and bus combo or get a taxi. Let's just say, we only got the bus once as we walked out the next morning after an awful breakfast and went to stop in a cheap pension hotel in Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Old high rise hotel with decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Readybluedragon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite high and well out of town. The housekeeping could have been better - very gruubby! Also, it is very noisy!! Rooms a good size and with a decent balcony. Beds comfortable and bathrooms of average size. A supermarket is about 10 minutes down the road (called a CASINO) as well as a fantastic outdoor pizzeria. Get there early (19:30) as it fills up quick and there is a long queue waiting for tables by 20:30. Food, wine and service here is great - which made out stay at the Rouge et Noir Hotel worthwhile. Would stay here again only for the pizzeria! Best in Italy and cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irena_Dior
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. I was afraid of previous bad comments, but found hotel tidy, clean very helpful staff (especially Mauro and housekeeping manager). Rooms comfortable, bathroom really nice and clean. Breakfast is not so variuos but taking into account it is Italy, so it is normal, especially pastries very delicious. We spent 4 nights, had a room on top floor.. and it was nice to sit out in the balcony during evenings after sightseeings. Yes, it is not so ease to come to hill where hotel is situated but come on.. do not be lazy, you could always take a shuttle if you like. Best way to get to hotel is to take metro line B to station Pietralata, then, bus stop just accross the street, take 211 and to Itor bustop, do not miss hotel name on your left. The location is not central but when you book 4 star hotel for such a price, do not expect central location. But after sightseeing you do not want to stroll around just to sleep in comfy bed.I would come back to this hotel and definatelly reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting- Filthy Hotel in Bad Neighborhood OUTSIDE Rome”
Reviews.Author: Italiacalcio
Reviews.Content: My husband, an Italian citizen, and I travel to Italy several times a year for business and pleasure, so we are very experienced in staying in hotels throughout Italy - from basic to superior. Plus every summer we take groups of soccer players and their families to Italy. All I can say is... thank god we didn't take one of our groups to this hotel - or we might be out of business! Luckily, we were only there one night with our 3 children before our return flight to the US after a 5-week stay in Italy. Though the rates were low, I would have been willing to pay double the price somewhere else just to have a clean room! It is NOT worthy of any 4- star rating – more like 2 stars. This was the first time in my many years of travel that I have ever taken photos of a hotel to post online and the only reason we did was to show we weren't kidding. We just couldn't believe how our stay deteriorated at every turn - even our kids felt the same. The only positive thing was the hotel restaurant - the food we had at dinner was surprisingly good. I am very familiar with the lovely city of Rome (all my grandparents were from there) but this area is really ugly. The hotel is in a very unpleasant area with graffiti on every building. You can see samples of that in the photos posted by others here. There are no nice places to walk to - and you wouldn't want to venture out in this neighborhood at any time. The hotel does have a shuttle bus to Rome - that's about the only convenience. The photos on the hotel website are very misleading as is the description of the “relaxing” Olympic size pool. First - the pool isn't Olympic sized and it isn't managed by the hotel, nor is the environment clean or relaxing, rather it's a community pool PACKED with people from the neighborhood - for which you pay 5.50 euro per person per day (with mandatory swim cap). The pool was dirty, not a lounge chair in sight, and the small deck areas were crammed with people - loud music blaring and people shouting, lots of cigarette smoking. The "bar" area of the pool was run by some rude kid who despite my speaking fluent Italian acted as though he didn't know what I meant when I asked to purchase the mandatory swim cap. He also refused to make change for a 10 euro note when my daughter wanted to buy 2 ice creams.. Absolutely ridiculous. You definitely would not want to bring any business group to this pool. Also, the hotel doesn’t let you pay at the front desk for pool usage. You have to deal with people at the pool – who don’t let you charge anything to your room – there is no true linkage between the pool and the hotel/ However, our greatest concern was inside of the hotel. We had 2 rooms for our family so it wasn't just a case of a one room problem. The first room my husband and I were given reeked of vomit the minute we opened the door and the carpet was filthy as were the walls. When the porter arrived to check the room, he had to step back into the hallway when he opened the door because the stench was so bad. He immediately ripped off the bed covers and threw them in the hallway. I was shocked that any cleaning staff would have even made up a room with such odor and NOT reported it to the management. Then again looking at the filth in halls and balconies – clearly the cleaning staff could care less. Speaking of management - no apologies from them about the vomit stench! When they gave us another room, we soon noticed the bedroom carpet was filthy with stains, the lamp shade had stains, and the walls had peeling wallpaper, and holes. The bathroom had mold, the base of the sink faucets leaked when turned on, the shower head kept falling down. Same scene in our children's room only they had the added pleasure of a balcony filled with cigarette butts. The hallway on our floor had dirty carpet and walls badly marked up. It looked like the halls hadn't been vacuumed in ages. I checked other floors thinking the halls might be dirty just on our floor but saw the same situation elsewhere. Also, no minibar in rooms – just vending machine in hallways (that ate our euro without dispensing the snacks – why was I not surprised? LOL) The bedroom doors are very thin and the windows not soundproofed so you'll also have the pleasure of being awakened by the student groups that I have learned, too late, frequent the place and party at all hours. Our youngest child woke up the next morning with large bug bites on her arms – which didn’t surprise anyone. Our kids are hardly picky about hotel conditions but they didn’t even want to get in those beds! See the photos to believe the facts. Stay away from this place. If If you have a tight budget, remember, there are plenty of reasonably priced lovely, clean B&Bs and small hotels right in the center of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “I agree! Make your own mind up!”
Reviews.Author: kat5682
Reviews.Content: Having read loads of reviews of this hotel I really didn't know what to expect as some said it was great, other rubbish. I really liked staying at this hotel. The rooms were clean with comfy beds - yes a little basic (like no tea and coffee bits). The hotel staff were helpful, and the shuttle bus was great, although only ran once every couple of hours and it was 2 euros return each. The pool was really nice, with a little cafe, although you had to pay before 5pm to go and use it but it was free from 5pm - 7pm which is great after a day out in Rome. Breakfast was continental and probably the bad bit about this hotel - quite basic and not much variety but it was totally edible and did exactly what it said on the tin. Price was reasonable (around £55 per night). Overall, we're a young couple, and so for us we really enjoyed the hotel. It did seem a little far out of town, but that was sometimes a blessing after the craziness of sightseeing with thousands of tourists. It was clean and comfy and we'd definitely go back again if we're ever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing about this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: jonathanbb
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel was when I checked out and even then the staff was not very pleasant. Way out of town and although there is a shuttle bus, the area is safe but not very nice at all. The rooms have the bare minumum with not even a kettle or coffee. Most of the staff were not very friendly or polite and seemed more irritated that they had to do something for you. Breakfast was very poor, usual pastires, some bread and a bit of cheese and ham (i think it was ham) I also had the misfortune of eating dinner there one night and ordered a medium fillet steak. I expected this to come with chips or potatoes plus some veggies but all I got was a very raw piece of meat, a few slices of tomato and some insipid letuce. I also ordered a beer that came without a glass so I had to drink from the bottle. Dont mind doing this at a bar but not while eating.

Reviews.Title: “Form your own opinion!”
Reviews.Author: big-city-break-fan
Reviews.Content: A little out of the city but the public transport links plus the hotel shuttle bus (there is a fee) overcome this. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpfull. One downside is - it is popular with student groups so can get a little noisy. The breafast is a little basic and if you do not get down very early - the hot water for the tea and the coffee can be cold but we asked for fresh tea which was brought to us no problem. There is a restaurant which has a limited menu but is okay. However, just down the road a couple of hundred yards is an excellent and very popular steak restaurant - next to a huge sports centre. Take a torch though or something reflective as there are no pavements on what is a very busy road.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: samfraser
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on recommendation from some reviews I read on Tripadvisor. I found the reviews to be quite accurate so I wont add much more just a few handy tips. The hotel is quite far out of the city centre so getting a taxi from the railway station will cost you about 20-30euro's. If you want to save some cash, get the Blue Metro line to Pietralata, when you come out of the station, cross the road to the bus stop over to the left. Get the 211 bus (you can use your Metro Ticket). The bus trip should take about 5mins, keep an eye out for the hotel on your left, it's quite hard to spot. If you go past a restaurant called BiSteak...you've gone to far, get off and walk back to the hotel, just about 10mins from BiSteak or just go straight into BiSteak food there is fabulous if you like your beef! We used the shuttle bus to get in and out of town, it's 3euro single/return. Ask for a room on a floor high up, sometimes youngsters on a group trip stay up late....enjoying their freedom and can be quite noisy. We were on floor 5 so weren't affected but met a couple that had to be moved. Nice hotel, would book again. Oh, they ask to keep your passport for the duration of your stay, just make sure they give it back when you check out!! We discovered they'd forgotten to give our passports back on our way back to the airport!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: clippersrule
Reviews.Content: Interior of hotel nice, but outside is industrial/urban. (see picture of front gate) Still, we & other tourists felt pretty safe from subway station to bus stop to hotel. A distance from the city, but that was a good thing if you want to get away from hustle & bustle of city after a long day of sightseeing. Hotel to city by bus/subway took about 30-40 minutes. (I thought the hotel shuttle was too time restrictive)Continental breakfast was good (redundant after 3 days) We had a nice room. Get a room with a city facing view. FCO to Hotel on the cheap (about 15 euros per person vs. 75 euros by cab) Take TrenItalia from FCO to Roma Tiburtina. At Roma Tiburtina, take subway to station Pietralata. (There is a grocery store next to subway station for snacks if you want.) Take bus 211 toward Cimone (across from subway station). Get off at (Itor) stop. (See bus stop pic). Walk 1 block back towards hotel. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: TaffyJones
Reviews.Content: We've just returned after staying at the Rouge Et Noir for 3 nights. In a nutshell, it's clean, the staff are helpful and the bedroom was more than comfortable. The hotel is on the outskirts of the city. However, it turned out to be a fantastic base to visit Rome from, especially with the coach service the hotel provides - 3 Euro's return per person, dropping off near the main bus and train station. It turned out to be a definite benefit as anything beats driving through those crazy streets in a hire car! On asking the hotel receptionist, we were directed to a Pizzeria about 400 metres away from the hotel. The food there was absolutely fantastic, typically Italian and reasonably priced (and so was the wine). Our deal through lastminute.com also included breakfast which consisted of bread, ham, cheese, coffee and juice. Nothing too elaborate, but substantial. Good hotel - especially for short city breaks, just don't be expecting the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel a little bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: aukfrequenttraveller
Reviews.Content: Getting there: Not easy - by public transport - a taxi - cost me 75 Euros from Rome Fiumicino Airport (FCO). Perhaps there's a cheaper way. Hotel arranged a taxi back to the airport on leaving that was 60 euros Hotel: Good sized room, clean, good views and a largish balcony (no furniture on the balcony). Breakfast OK, evening meal was average. Nice terrace bar with views Access to City: They run a coach service to the city & back (about 6 out & 6 times back per day) that costs 3 euros return & takes about 30 minutes. I found this service to be very reliable. The drop off point in the city is about 10 minures walk from the main railway station from where you can get tour busses etc. Staff: Reasonable English spoken & they were helpful. (the only tours available from the hotel were German speaking, but you can get all the tours you want in the city). Other: Rome is a wonderful city but is expensive (not unusual to pay 8 euros for a beer in tourist areas) General: Not an ideal location but the price was right when I was booking

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: annelu
Reviews.Content: We stayed (2 couples) last summer one week in this hotel. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and the staff is helpful. The nearest undergroundstation is about 2km from the hotel. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the station. If you dont want to walk, you can take bus number 211 to the undergroundstation. The busstop is about 200 meters from the hotel. The hotel has also a good shuttle service to the city. There are 3 exellent and cheap lokal restaurangs in the neighborhood, about 200-400 meters away from the hotel (bisteak, laboratorium 3, if I remember right the names). And the pool beside the hotel is perfect at summertime. If you dont mind to walk a little bit and if you dont want to party all night long so this hotel is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “decent quality at a low price”
Reviews.Author: Tinkbugga
Reviews.Content: I took my 3 boys age 11,8 and 6 for a three day break to Rome. We flew into Ciampino, took the metro to Termini and followed the hotel's own directions. Be careful, they made no sense to me and we ended up getting a taxi instead. When we arrived our family room was clean and comfortable. We were on the 6th floor and had good views across Rome. The hotel bus into Rome was good value at just 3 euros each for a return trip. The pool was a big hit with the boys, although I was surprised to have to pay for them to swim. Restaurant was the most diappointing thing about the hotel. it was very expensive in comparison to restaurants in Rome and the quality was bad. But, all in all, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Hated this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaggiF
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis that it was "close to the City Centre" - don't believe it. It was a metro ride of about 8 stops out of Rome, then a 3 mile walk or bus ride through suburbs that were not nice, then a walk along an un-made section of road with no street lighting, up the hill to the hotel. The look of the hotel was not very nice, although inside was light and airy. Rooms were OK, but no more than that. They were lovely and clean and towels were changed every day. The restaurant was absolutely terrible. On our first night there the dining room was closed. Another night we were given a choice of spaghetti and meatballs - or nothing ! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place ”
Reviews.Author: de8n_dunning
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is actualy ok but the location is dreadful. We had hired a car from Ciampino Airport and had to drive using the map provided. The hotel is situated in a suberb called Via Pietrlata. There are not many shops here. If you require cigarettes bring them with you as cannot buy them localy unless you smoke malbrough and you get them from machines in the wall for about 3.50 euros. The hotel staff were freindly although English was very vague. When we arrived we were given a key to a room pointed the direction of the lift and nothing else. We were not advies about breakfast times or any other services available to us. It does have a pool but they let the locals use it for about 9 euros a day so was always full even thought the hotel was not. We didnt eat at the hotels so cannot advise on food but while we stayed the we did not see a resterant. The interior was done to a very high standard and was always very clean. The rooms was nice a had a bathroom with shower. We stayed on the 8th floor and had a great view out into the centre of Rome. Travel by car around rome is not reccomended unless you have satnav as it is poorly signed. We travel by car to the Train terminal then used the metro to get to the sights of Rome. Although the Hotel is nice i would not reccomend unless you have CAR<SATNAV<and the patiences of a saint.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were 4 people on this trip. We stayed in this hotel because we booked a package in madrid and there was no choice of hotels. You were told the hotel name after you have paid the package. The hotel itself is not bad, but the location is scary. The entrance of the hotel at night is dark as it can be. It is very far from the city (in a suburb called Pietralata) so we had to take the subway plus a bus and sitting at the bus stop at 11PM is not pleasant at all. We couldn't stay in the city after 10:30pm because there will be no way of getting to the hotel except taxis which are extremely expensive. At least the hotel should have a shuttle to take you back and forth from the city. We would not reccomend this hotel unless you are with a big group and provided transportation.

Reviews.Title: “"Don't" review misleading”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took a group of 20+ students to Rome, and stayed at Rouge et Noir. After having read the "Don't" review, I was a bit apprehensive about staying there. Even though it was off the beaten trail, my group found it to be fine. The employees were kind and there was a pool. I would much rather stay with a group of students in a safe, clean hotel, rather than in a cramped one in a questionable area of the city. As far as transportation, we had a tour bus, so it was a non-issue.

HotelInfo.Name: Rouge Et Noir
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cosimo De 'Giorgi 8 | Via Di Pietralata 162, 00158 Rome, Italy
